title: If you're full-build + elixir, why take all the farm?
body:
Hasn't happened to me in a while but I actually question the decision. It doesn't just happen in low elo (where I'm at), but also in pro play. Fnatic will give Rekkles all the farm even if he's at 6 items no boots + elixir and level 18, while the rest of the team is behind in levels and items.

I can understand the need to waveclear obviously outweighs the desire to farm in certain situations, like when the enemy is seiging. But when they're not, why hog all the creeps and jg camps?

replies.body:
1. My S-rank (for chest or mastery emote).
2. If no one else is around, I'm going to clear the wave so we don't lose map pressure.

> [{quoted}](name=Snapp2Kill,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=UEr3AWkQ,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2018-03-27T19:14:05.375+0000)
>
> I needs muh S rank

Probably accurate, and this right here is why the mastery system shouldn't exist as it does. Time invested should be all that matters. I get that they don't want M7 to go to players who aren't good at the champion, but let's be honest, you can bumble your way to M7 with enough effort anyway.

Having people aiming for mastery just further divides a team into five individuals all looking out for themselves.

> [{quoted}](name=Zero Shingetsu,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=UEr3AWkQ,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2018-03-27T19:24:44.551+0000)
>
> Probably accurate, and this right here is why the mastery system shouldn't exist as it does. Time invested should be all that matters. I get that they don't want M7 to go to players who aren't good at the champion, but let's be honest, you can bumble your way to M7 with enough effort anyway.
> 
> Having people aiming for mastery just further divides a team into five individuals all looking out for themselves.

Most players think mastery means KDA if they try to aim for it at all.

The ones that actually understand the system also understand it is synonymous with winning the game, and just do both at once.

I cant speak for the people who insist they can never get an S, but i get one every 3-4 games while playing a champion i am familiar with.. but i also have a winrate around 65-70% with most of those champions.

It drops off sharply for less-experienced champions, regardless of knowing roughly how the system works.

I know that for me personally, if I happen to be carrying my team, having a stock pile of gold would allow me to radically shift my build late into the game. For example, if I’m having trouble assassinating a Caitlyn as a Quinn Top, I could use the gold + the sell value of 1 item to straight buy RFC to burst her down from far away.

If you're hard carrying your team and it gets late enough to where you already have full build + elixir, you can stockpile gold without stealing it all from the rest of your team though. By further guaranteeing you are the solo team carry and denying gold from the rest of your team, you put yourself at a disadvantage the longer the game goes on.

If the enemy team has two carries, and one of them dies, they can still rely on one other. Your team just has you. If you get caught out or focused down, now your team has to win a teamfight from far behind, even if you trade 1-for-1 with an enemy carry.
In many situations its better to just allowed rekkless clear the farm asap , so they can spend there time rotating or placing ward vision.

A lot of it is just built in muscle memory and habit really, but games aren't typically supposed to run that long.

More macrowise, the full build power house is probably able to very quickly waveclear, and further by virtue of being full build they're probably the safest alone (contingent on strong map awareness and vision, since I realise lone adcs are pretty juicy), while the not-quite full build people are safest banded together.

Clearing jg camps can sometimes be used to deny enemy gold as well just in case the enemy happens to be in the area before the camp respawns.
I ban Teemo whenever I top. Then again I hate every single top lane champ/matchup and would prefer if I never had to play that role ever
